bibl.title: Letter from Thomas C. Lazear to Mabel H. Lazear, December 26, 1907

div1.p: Thomas Lazear provides family news, and details pending action on the pension increase.

div1.head: Letter from Thomas C. Lazear to Mabel H. Lazear, December 26, 1907
div1.p:
Thanks for the photograph
of Houston which came in time to appear
among our other Christmas gifts-
None was more welcome than
this picture of the dear little boy
and none more admired- The
resemblance to his father is most
striking- I wish you had included
yourself and little Peggy all in a
group as one family- Whenever
you have such a group taken
do not forget to send it to me-
I want to see you all while I
live and possibly this may be
the only way I shall see you.

In regard to the pension, I will
2
be disappointed if Congress should fail
to pass it. The only difficulty to be
apprehended is the Rule to which
Mr Dalzell referred adopted by the
Pension Committee but I hardly think
this will be insisted on in your
case- Mr. Dalzell said that yours
is an exceptional case and one
of special merit- The rule
was no doubt adopted to
prevent annoying importunity
in ordinary cases- Everything
possible is being done to secure
the passage of the bill with
powerful influences behind it and
I believe it will go through-
Dr. Mansfelde is working like
3
a Trojan to that end and I am doing
all I can to help him.

I wish I could sit out doors
with you and the children at this
time in your lovely climate- Instead
of green trees, and beautiful flowers
and foliage, I see from my window
nothing but dreary winter sights-
If I were not so old - now
76 years old, and could stand
the fatigue of travel as I could
in my younger days, I would think
seriously of a trip to Santa Barbara
to see your little family - But I
realize that I should not undertake
such a journey at my age

My last word from Windsor was
that all were suffering from the
Grippe, Mrs. Sweitzer among the number
We have it also at our house,
my son in law Mr. Orr and his son
Penn (one of the twins) being victims -
That disease seems to prevail
everywhere in the North and East-
You probably know nothing of it
in California-

I hope Houston & Peggy found
toys to suit them - Hug them
for me-
div1.closer:
Yours affectionately Thos C Lazear Mrs Mabel H. Lazear
P.S. You did not enclose Dr Mansfelde letter
though you said you did- But no matter,
I hear from him often
T.C.L.
